description: The cause of the issue outlined in CVE-2023-44323 stems from a flaw in Adobe software utilized by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). This flaw can lead to remote code execution under certain circumstances. Specifically, the vulnerability is associated with the version of Microsoft Edge at build number 118.0.2088.76, as well as earlier builds like 118.0.5993.117 for Windows 10. The problem persists until the application is updated to the latest version, thereby eliminating the technical shortcomings present in the prior versions. As documented in KB-118.0.2088.76, ensuring that the software is consistently updated is vital for safeguarding against potential exploitation stemming from this vulnerability.
